com.linesengine.physics

Class BoxBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linesengine.physics.PhysicsBody
      • com.linesengine.physics.BoxBody

  • public class BoxBody
extends PhysicsBody
    BoxBody is a child object of PhysicsBody that simulates collision and movement for a box shaped are

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Vector2 bl 
      Vector2 br 
      Vector2 tl 
      Vector2 tr

        friction, gravity, hasCollided, hasRotated, height, mass, position, rotation, size, velocity, width

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoxBody()
      Creates a new BoxBody that is 50*50 by default.
      BoxBody(float size)
      Creates a new box body of given size.
      BoxBody(float size, Vector2 pos)
      Creates a new box body of given size, at certain position.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float distance(Vector2 point)
      Distance from the center of the box to a specific point.
      Vector2[] getCollisionNormals()
      Creates collision normals, which are vectors perpendicular to the given sides.

      Checks whether this BoxBody is colliding with any given PhysicsBody.

      Checks whether this specific box is colliding with another specific box.

      A specific check whether this BoxBody is colliding with a CircleBody.

      Gets the middle of the box in world space.

      Moves the box by moving all the corner points.

      Transforms the velocity and rotation of this object on box collision.

      Transforms the velocity and rotation of this (and the other) object on circle collision.

      Rotates the box.

      Scales a box outwards from the center equally.

        pos - starting position of the box

        Parameters:

      • resolveCircleCollision

        public void resolveCircleCollision(CircleBody other)
        Transforms the velocity and rotation of this (and the other) object on circle collision.
        Parameters:

      • isCollidingWithBox

        public boolean isCollidingWithBox(BoxBody other)
        Checks whether this specific box is colliding with another specific box.
        Parameters:
        other - the other BoxBody we check if this BoxBody is colliding with
        Returns:
        is the box colliding or not

      • getCollisionSideVector

        public Vector2 getCollisionSideVector(PhysicsBody other)
        Gets the box side that has been collided with and turns it into a collision normal. The collision normal is aligned with the collided side. This can then be added to the velocity of the other object that collided.
        Parameters:
        other - the other PhysicsBody that has collided with this BoxBody
        Returns:
        the specific collision normal of this box

      • physicsRotation

        public void physicsRotation(PhysicsBody other)
        Calculates the rotational behavior to be applied when two objects collide.
        Parameters:
        other - the other body that this one is colliding with

      • rotateBoth

        public void rotateBoth(float amt,
                       PhysicsBody other)
        A shortcut method to rotate two given PhysicsBodys.
        Parameters:
        amt - amount of rotation
        other - the other PhysicsBody to be rotated

                         Vector2 direction)
        Gets the minimum and maximum points of the box in any given direction.
        Parameters:
        body - the BoxBody of which min and max we get
        direction - the direction of the minimum and maximum
        Returns:
